alert.note: Alert for Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 9:02AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Grande Near San Ildefonso Pueblo affecting Santa Fe and Los Alamos Counties. Rio Grande At Rio Grande at Embudo affecting Santa Fe, Los Alamos and Rio Arriba Counties. .Warm temperatures have melted snowpack and increased river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Rio Grande at Rio Grande at Embudo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Access to riverside picnic facilities above Pilar but below the Taos Junction Bridge may be affected due to flooding. Water is about to flow over the center section of the low swinging bridge upstream of the Embudo Gauging Station. This wooden bridge is used by local residents who live on the west side of the river. No significant damages are expected until the river rises to 12 feet or higher. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM MDT Monday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday afternoon and continue rising to 10.2 feet Saturday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 1015 PM MDT.

area.areaDesc: Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Santa Fe
